content.description: SDS left around the arete and right hand on a toothy spot. Move up using the nice edge on the right then the arete before gaining the grippy slopers.
content.location: On the smaller boulder that forms the left side of the cave.

content.description: Squat start on the good left hand and right crimp, then move to the perfect flat edge in the middle of the face. Check to the arete then a positive lip. Step left and mantle.
content.location: On the inside face of the small boulder that forms the left side of the cave.

content.description:
A massive, overhanging face close to 20ft at the lip. Features are present but far apart which may result in a few very hard problems. A more reasonable problem may start around to the right near two pockets and work up to the left just under the lip to a sloping top-out near the first cleft. The shorter boulder forming the left side of the A-frame cave has two short but good problems: the arete and face just right of it. The "locals" have been using this cave as a toilet for eons resulting in a pleasant aroma in warmer months. Not as bad when its cold.  

  On the uphill (east) side of the boulder, several eliminates and variations make for good warm-ups. 

   V0 The face by the palo verde branch. 12ft.    V1 Right of that    V1 Climb the right leaning holds up the bulge.
